block.p: Erin Michelle Graves, a daughter of Bonnie and Michael Graves of Bloomington, Minn., was married in Manhattan yesterday to Roger van Blerkom Gould, a son of Lois Gould of Manhattan and the late Philip Benjamin. Judge Saralee Evans of Manhattan Civil Court officiated at the Friends Meeting House.

Ms. Graves, 25, is keeping her name. She is a candidate for a master's degree in urban planning at the University of Illinois at Chicago. She graduated from Stanford University. Her father is a professor of education at the University of Minnesota at Minneapolis. Her mother is the author of ''No Copycats Allowed'' (Hyperion, 1998) and other children's books.

Erin Michelle Graves, a daughter of Bonnie and Michael Graves of Bloomington, Minn., was married in Manhattan yesterday to Roger van Blerkom Gould, a son of Lois Gould of Manhattan and the late Philip Benjamin. Judge Saralee Evans of Manhattan Civil Court officiated at the Friends Meeting House.

Ms. Graves, 25, is keeping her name. She is a candidate for a master's degree in urban planning at the University of Illinois at Chicago. She graduated from Stanford University. Her father is a professor of education at the University of Minnesota at Minneapolis. Her mother is the author of ''No Copycats Allowed'' (Hyperion, 1998) and other children's books.

Mr. Gould, 38, is a professor of sociology at Yale University. He was until recently the editor in chief of the American Journal of Sociology and an associate professor of sociology, both at the University of Chicago. The bridegroom graduated from Harvard University, from which he also received a Ph.D. in sociology.

His mother is a writer in Manhattan whose most recent book, ''Mommy Dressing: A Love Story, After a Fashion'' (Anchor Books, 1998), is a memoir about her mother, the fashion designer Jo Copeland. His father was a reporter for The New York Times. The bridegroom's adoptive father, the late Dr. Robert E. Gould, was a psychiatrist in private practice and the chief of adolescent services at Bellevue Hospital, both in Manhattan.
